location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: File 4673/1919 Pt 2 ‘Persian Gulf:- Visit to England of the son of the Sheikh of Bahrein + party. Employment of Political officers with party. 1 Capt N.N.E. Bray. 2 [Capt] A.H.S. Campbell. 3 [Capt] S.E. Hedgcock.’

mods.abstract: This part consists of India Office correspondence mostly relating to the employment of Norman Napier Bray, Captain S E Hedgcock, and Captain A H S Campbell as Political Officers accompanying the visit of a Mission (deputation) from Bahrein [Bahrain] (consisting of ‘Abdullah bin ‘Īsá Āl Khalīfah, son of Shaikh Isa of Bahrein, Abdullah’s son Muhammad, Abdullah’s Private Secretary Jasim Cheravi, and a personal servant) to England and Scotland, and their return journey to the Persian Gulf.The correspondence is largely between John Evelyn Shuckburgh, Secretary of the India Office Political Department and Bray, Hedgcock, and Campbell. This part also includes India Office internal notes between Shuckburgh and others.
